channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Old fence posts and rubbish, 5th December
item.description:
A new fence has been erected by a resident in Avington grove and although the metal chain link fence I reported has been removed they have left behind broken fence posts and other rubbish which is still going to be dangerous to park users particularly children and dogs. Please remove all the dangerous wood and metal rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avington Grove, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Build-up of leaves on the Cycle Track from Thornet Wood car park towards the Gin Site, 5th December
item.description:

item.title: Overflowing bin with fly-tipping as part cause, 5th December
item.description:
Either the waste collection schedule is now too infrequent (all of street seems in similar state) or a collection has been missed because bins are overflowing and next collection is not due till 12th December. Fly-tipped rubbish photographed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cadogan Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Offensive graffiti - Alleyway between Chipperfield and Curtismill, 5th December
item.description:
There are multiple instances of graffiti in the alleyway between 289 and 291 Chipperfield Road leading to Curtismill. This includes antisemitic, racist, and personally targeted. Please could these be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 291, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Bins permanentl left on footpath., 5th December
item.description:
